parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From pule; a gate-way, door-way of a building or city; by implication, a portal or vestibule.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To run in, run into. From eis and trecho; to hasten inward.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To report (from one place to another), bring a report, announce, declare. From apo and the base of aggelos; to announce.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
A primary preposition; 'fore', i.e. In front of, prior to.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From pule; a gate-way, door-way of a building or city; by implication, a portal or vestibule.
